1.comment: Trent Edwards finished 19-of-30, 215 yards and a touchdown. Those numbers aren't great, but keep in mind that Edwards began the game 1-of-6 for 7 yards. Edwards found a groove late in the second quarter, allowing the Bills to run away with this game.    Speaking of poor starts,

3.comment: Trent Edwards was able to go 6-of-8 for 92 yards and a touchdown on his team's final 2 drives, leading the Bills to a 24-23 comeback victory.    As a whole, Edwards was 24-of-39 for 279 yards, 1 score and a pick.

7.comment: Trent Edwards made 3 crucial errors in the final 15 minutes. He threw an interception, fumbled the ball away on a 4.h-and-short opportunity and took a sack in the end zone, which resulted in a safety.    Edwards still managed to throw for 227 yards on 21-of-35 passing. He located

8.comment: Trent Edwards threw a 22-yard dart to Roscoe Parish. Fortunately for Mangini's job security and further scrutiny in this column, Edwards tossed a pick-six a couple of plays later.    I guess I shouldn't bash Pizza Delivery Boy that much; the Jets won at Orchard Park for only the second time since 2002.

9.comment: Trent Edwards was absolutely horrendous in this game. He was 13-of-23 for 120 yards, 1 touchdown and 2 picks, but those figures don't tell the whole story. Edwards missed wide-open receivers all afternoon, while his picks were very untimely; 1 led to a New England score, while the other was in Patriots territory. 21.comment: Trent Edwards left the game in the beginning of the second quarter with a concussion. Edwards hit all 5 of his passes for 43 yards, but he missed a wide-open

22.comment: Trent Edwards out and put on his uniform, but those passes sure were impressive.    Edwards went 18-of-28 for 185 yards, 1 touchdown and a pick that went right through Owens' hands. That means that if you take away Owens' 2 long grabs, Edwards was just 16-of-26 for 102 yards, giving him a gaudy YPA of 3.9. Thanks for the effort, Trent.

23.comment: Trent Edwards suffered a knee injury and left the game. Fitzpatrick would then lead Buffalo to 2 red-zone appearances. He hit

24.comment: Trent Edwards was 4-of-7 for 8 yards. When he hit his next pass, I posted the following on the forum, Trent Edwards has hit double-digit passing yards!!! - The Bills had just 9 first downs in this game. - Buffalo was 3-of-14 on third downs (as a comparison, Miami was 8-of-18). - The Bills had only 72 yards on their first 9 possessions. - Of Buffalo's first 7 possessions, 5 were 3.and-outs. - This 1 is from LeeLee: The Bills have 76 yards of offense after 3 quarters. Three NFL teams have had single plays longer than that today.    Edwards finished 18-of-34 for 139 yards and a touchdown. His refusal to throw the ball downfield - even at the end of the game when he had no choice - is really disturbing. He cannot be allowed to start any longer.

25.comment: Trent Edwards injured. Bouman's kids were too young to remember him under center, so they got to watch to watch their dad play the Chiefs. Things started well - the camera panned to his wife and children whenever he made a good play - but it all fell apart in the second half. Bouman tossed a pick-six in the third quarter and struggled from that point on. He finished 18-of-34 for 222 yards, 2 touchdowns and a pair of picks. Romeo Crennel, looking rather snazzy in a sweater vest and jacket, finally figured out how to stop the great Bouman.

27.comment: Trent Edwards struggle against the worst defense in football. Edwards had just 2 completions in the first half (2-of-6). He finished 12-of-25 for 117 yards, 1 touchdown and an interception. David Garrard, meanwhile, phoned into the CBS broadcasting team in the second quarter. It was really strange hearing him talk on the phone while his team was playing.    The Jaguars were able to stick around for a while with a strong running game despite not having Maurice Jones-Drew.
